The swarthy teenager is being interrogated by COL. HARDWI

But the enemy would be sadly mistaken  if they were to doubt our resolve.  They are now face to face with the  most fearsome killing machine in the  history of man. And I intend to use  it. And be back on base in time for  the play-offs... That is all.
Devereaux sees Hub and strides over to him:
Hub. Good to see you again.
I can't say the same, sir. Not in  that uniform. I thought you were  against this.
I am against it. It wasn't my call.
"I'm only following orders" didn't  work at Nuremberg. It may not be  your policy but they're your tactics.
Your operation had its chance, Hub,  and you couldn't get it done. You're  down three touchdowns. Time to bring  in the first string.
Against our own team?
Devereaux suddenly goes ice cold.
Are you questioning my patriotism?
I'm questioning your judgement, yes,  sir.

Hub, I want you to take a moment and  reflect on my life as a soldier. I  have a dozen tropical diseases I'll  never entirely get rid of. I set off  metal detectors with the shrapnel in  my ass. I have watched men die and I  have killed. Now I am serving my  President and quite possibly not the  best interests of my country, but my  profession doesn't afford me the  luxury of that distinction. I won't  question your patriotism but don't  you ever again question my command.
I'm not under your command, General.

Take a good look around, my friend,  and tell me that's still true. (softening his tone) But we're not shutting you out. In  fact, I can't do it without you,  Hub. I need men like you. Men willing  to put it on the line like you did  in that schoolroom. (gestures to his  uniform) These stars mean I have been putting  it on the line for thirty years...  and never made a mistake worth  remembering. Don't tell me I made a  mistake about you.
Hub and Sharon exit the command tent.
(ironic) They're not shutting us out. They  need men like me.
He'll fuck it up, the arrogant prick.  You ever met anybody so in love with  the sound of his own voice?
We're putting Samir in play.
Now? With all this going on? He's  freaked.

Oh, right, he's high-strung. Only  you can manage him. You and the CIA  and the DIA and God-knows-who-else  you're really working for --! (seething) Get back in there, Sharon, Elise,  whatever the fuck your name is --  They'll probably make you a Colonel...  if you're not one already.
She gestures at the military leviathan.
All this... is no more in our interest  than it is in yours, Hub.
What, exactly, are your interests,  Sharon? You protect Samir, you protect  the agency. You're interested in  protecting everything but your  country.
You have no idea what I do for my  country.
No, and I don't want to know. With  you or without you we're putting  Samir in play. Now.
She looks at him for a long moment. Considering:
One more lamb to the slaughter.

head_text.subj: A HALF-OPENED DOOR OF AN APARTMENT

text: Samir looks and sees Hub, standing beside Sharon.
Oh, my God. Oh, my God...
He tries to SLAM the door, but they force it open. He gra A FAT JOINT from an ashtray and hurries into the bathroom
(to Sharon) Does he understand the difference  between the FBI and the DEA?
Samir... It's fine, he's cool.
OUTSIDE, the sound of gunfire. Samir reappears, wild-eyed
Listen to that --! Are you listening?  They're killing Arabs out there!
You can stop it all right now.
What are you talking about --? The  army is here. They're setting up  interrogation centers right now.  They're torturing people in cellars.
Let's just calm down for a second...
-- I've got to get out of here. You  have to help me --
He goes over and peers out the drawn curtains.
(gentling a horse) We'll take care of you... don't worry.  You just have to calm down --
Money... I must have more money...
-- You got a student visa for Ali  Waziri. Because... somebody asked  you to -- Didn't they --?
I... got it myself.
Sharon CRACKS him across the face.
Liar --!
Now it's Samir's turn to taste the blood in his mouth.
You... tell him... what he wants to  know.
(to Sharon) Hey, that's enough.
He knows. He fucking knows.
She's crazy. They're ghosts. Jinn.  They'd never trust someone like me.
Stop simpering.
Please...

I've got a picture of the two of us,  do you remember that picture, Samir? (the mask coming off:) I'm going to post that picture in  every mosque in Brooklyn. And then  I'm gonna send copies to some friends  of mine on the West Bank. You've got  family there, don't you --?
Hub jumps up, takes Sharon by the arm.
Let go of me --
He gives her the BUM'S RUSH out of the apartment, shuts t door, then turns back to Samir, who sits, ashen-faced.
Now... Nobody's going to burn you,  nobody's going to call anybody -- (sits beside him) -- Who asked you to get that visa?
Samir is trembling. Tears roll down his cheeks.
Don't be afraid. I can protect you.  There's nothing to be afraid of.
I'm afraid of going to hell.
Hub just sits there. He knows he's got him. Finally:
His name is Tariq Husseini. He runs  an auto shop. (Hub waits for more --) ...on Commerce Street in Red Hook.
(hands him a card) My beeper number. Anybody messes  with you, I'm there in twenty minutes.
He gets up and walks into:
Where Sharon waits. As they head for the stairs we HEAR:
You're good.
You're not so bad yourself.
But we are HEARING IT along with:
In a nearby SURVEILLANCE VEHICLE -- where, through the ne microwave technology (the kind the FBI don't yet have), h has OVERHEARD the entire conversation.
In his lap, the name, "Tariq Husseini."
They are in a housing project. Hub dials his cell phone.
You calling Devereaux.
Didn't get his number. Darn. (on the phone) Floyd, Hub. We need to put something  together in a big-ass hurry... Where's  Frank --?... Give him a 911.
A YELLOW SCHOOL BUS pulls up beside them and armed soldie hop out. Sharon watches them as Hub continues:
(on the phone) -- and find some kind of beat-up  car... Well, beat it up yourself if  you have to... 896 Commerce St...  it's a garage in Red Hook... but  remember -- (looks at her) -- they're pros.
A PSY-OPS VAN passes by, broadcasting through a P.A.
-- all persons without proper  authorization must be off the street  until seven a.m. Failure to comply  will result in immediate arrest.
The announcement is then repeated in Arabic.
They come upon several more YELLOW SCHOOL BUSES. From wit the various apartments the SHRILL PROTESTS of mothers and sisters as YOUNG MEN fitting the "terrorist profile" are  hustled into the BUSES.
Jesus...
Tariq will go to ground.
We can hit him in less than an hour.
(turns to leave) Hit him hard.
Where are you going?
I've got to stash Samir someplace  safe. (as she goes) Go with God.

Hub hurries on toward his car, passing TEENAGE GIRLS,  defiantly wearing Keffiyahs, who mill about, taunting sol with obscenities in English and Arabic. AN APC drives past, further inflaming their passions. Suddenly, A volley ROCKS AND BOTTLES come hurtling out of nowhere, smashing harmlessly against the armor. The teena laugh. And then, the sudden CONCUSSION of a small BLAST from UP STREET. The teenagers SCREAM and scatter. Hub SPRINTS tow A SMOKING CAR, pulling his weapon from his hip. A SOLDIER IS ROLLING ON THE GROUND, SCREAMING beside a PA CAR. His leg is shredded. ARMORED JEEPS come squealing ar a corner. M-16's are locked, loaded and leveled at Hub.
FBI --! FBI --!
For a moment, it's touch-and-go as the the terrified RECR just weeks out of basic training, decide whether to SHOOT On the ground, the injured soldier keeps SCREAMING.
Now... I'm gonna... reach... into my  jacket... and show you... my shield.
Drop your weapon --!
Hub drops the gun and shows his credentials. The young so approaches warily as MEDICS attend to the wounded man.
Sorry, Sir. Somebody's booby-trapping  cars... We're all a little spooked.
The RATTLE of small-arms fire is HEARD from up the street In the distance, a running FIGURE is chased by three SOLD The transformation is complete: Brooklyn as Gaza.
Hub climbs in. On a nearby pock-marked wall, a single wor "Intifada."
Hub, who sits in a beat-up old car, a baseball cap worn  backwards on his head. He keys his radio.
All Units, report in turn. If talking  will reveal your position, just key  your walkie...

Inside, an AUTO GARAGE. Hoists, compression cylinders,  archwelders. Outside, two WINOS share a bottle by the cur A BEAT-UP DODGE drives up. In it, two scruffy-looking Bla MEN. Upon close inspection we realize that one is Hub. Th other is Floyd.
(to a mechanic) Yo...
The mechanic looks out from under a car. He's Hispanic.
Que Pasa?
Tariq around?
The mechanic gestures to a partitioned-office in the back As Hub heads toward it, he checks out the other workers: teenager doing a compression check, another fixes a tire.
Tariq is on the phone talking in Arabic as Hub enters.
Tariq?
Tariq holds up a finger, hold on. Hub sits opposite him.
How can I help you.
You're Tariq Husseini?
He's out.
Damn. Do you think you could give  him a message?
Of course.
Tell him the FBI is after him.
You're joking.
Very... slowly... put your hands on  top of the table.
Tariq notices that Hub's hands are out of sight beneath t table. Hub draws back the slide of his the weapon with an audible CLICK. Tariq mutters a CURSE in Arabic.
That wouldn't be a racist epithet,  now would it? Stand up.
As Tariq stands, Hub crosses behind him, kicks out his le pats him down, and cuffs him.
The two winos have revealed themselves as shotgun-wieldin FBI agents and are now ROUSTING the garage workers.
Where are the others?
What others?
But before Hub can answer, an AMPLIFIED VOICE is heard.
Tariq Husseini, this is the United  States Army. You are surrounded.
Hub is as surprised as Tariq.
You have thirty seconds to throw out  any weapons and exit the premises  with your hands on top of your head.
One of the agents with the shotgun calls out.
-- Sir?
Do as he says.
As Hub hustles Tariq to his feet, the other agents start hustle the workers out of door, when:
Reaches into his overalls.
FREEZE--!
But when the Mechanic pulls his hand out from his overall all he is holding is the pin to a GRENADE.
Kills both the FBI agents and their prisoners. Hub throws Tariq to the ground.
An AUTOMATIC WEAPON opens fire on the Army presence.
Devereaux responds with a dispassionate intensity.
Code blue.
His order unleashes an overwhelming display of FIREPOWER.

Hub and Tariq crawl for cover as windows EXPLODE, walls a SHREDDED, and incendiary TRACER rounds mix with solvents gasoline to start a conflagration. With the vaguely  hallucinatory quality of the S.L.A. shootout, WHITE NOISE bleeds in and ALL SOUND FADES OUT:
Races in from around the corner, only to be hit by A ROCK PROPELLED GRENADE fired through the second floor window.
Code Red.
Appear from their hiding place behind a nearby building. they dive into their attack trajectory --
Crawls, dragging Tariq toward the doors as:
Of the Attack helicopter fires 2,000 rounds a minute --  virtually UNZIPPING the warehouse -- softening it for THE TWO HYDRA ROCKETS that reduce it instantly to a huge FIRE
Watches the awesome display of firepower with calm detach
Stagger, blinded, out of the inferno. Hub drags a half- conscious Tariq, where they are pounced on by commandos.
Pac's and Tanks ring the stadium. An anti-terrorist perim has been established -- concrete obstacles, sandbags and  razor-wire. Musco-lights cast their pitiless glow.
A mob of frightened parents, girlfriends, and furious fat A LAWYER for the ACLU confronts a young Lieutenant.
-- just want to know if my client's  name is on the list.
Sir, the list will be updated every  twelve hours and posted in the --
A gaggle of JOURNALISTS try to force their way in...
-- This pass GUARANTEES... You CAN'T --  ...the first FUCKING AMENDMENT!
There will be a pool briefing for  all accredited journalists at 0700  hours.
Hub shows his ID. Is allowed to enter into:
A MUFFLED CRY that might or might not have come from some in pain. His footsteps ECHO as he walks out to where:
All young men between the ages of sixteen and thirty are  milling about. Squatting, smoking, pacing, some laughing, most looking terrified. All spread across:
Armed GUARDS backlit in the upper tiers. Enlisted men pas out blankets and soup. Nearby, Hub sees Tina, standing qu still -- Finally, she is able to speak.
1942, my father was put into the  camps at Manzanar. Until the end of  the war. Two years. Now he roots for  the Dodgers and swears it could never  happen again.
Hub asks for Devereaux, is directed across the field, thr an aisle in the wire cages. FRANK HADDAD looms out of the shadows. He looks terrible, drawn. Furious.
They got Frankie. My kid's here  someplace --
Frank, slow down --
(fighting back tears  of rage) He's only thirteen, for Chrissake --
Nearby, the "Allahuh Akbar," call, to evening PRAYER.
I'll get him out.
They came into my house. My wife  told them who I was -- (swallows hard) How many times did I put it on the  line, Hub --? How many times --
Frank --
We're American citizens, twenty years.  Ten years in the bureau -- They  knocked her down... and took him.  Out of my own house.
It's wrong, Frank. What can I say to  you, but it's... all... terribly...  horribly... wrong. (takes his arm) Now, come with me.
NO! I've got to find him. Besides,  this is where I belong. (takes out his wallet,  hands over his badge) Here. I'm not their sand nigger  anymore.
Hub watches as he he walks away. A MUEZZIN chants the cal to evening prayer. Frank drops to his knees and joins the rest of the prisoners.
Has been transformed in a COMMAND POST.
-- And his name is Haddad?
Frank... Haddad. Junior.
His father's a Shiite. We're checking  him out.
Check this out, pal. His father's a  federal agent for ten years.
Don't get in my face, Hubbard. I  might decide you're an Ethiopian.
And you're just stupid enough to  think that's an insult.
If a mistake's been made we'll fix  it.
There is no "if". I'm vouching for  this kid. I want him out.
And I said we will look into it.
You mean, like you're looking into  me? Surveilling me? Breaking up my  operations? If I'd known I was going  to have to do your job for you I  would never have left the army.
There's an FBI office in Anchorage,  Agent Hubbard. Fuck with me and you'll  be learning a hundred and fifty new  words for snow.
The two men stare at each other.
Tariq Husseini is my prisoner. I  want to see him.
The prisoner is being interrogated.
I want to see him.
Devereaux just looks at him as we CUT TO:

Tariq is strapped, NAKED, into a folding metal chair. His head lolls on his chest, his eyes are dulled. On a nearby table, an empty syringe. Two MP'S stand guard. Sharon is speaking softly to him in Arabic. Suddenly, Tar SPITS in her face. She wipes it off as if it is nothing.
How long have you been at it?
Not long enough, apparently.
How much longer, do you think, before  he gives up the other cells --
He can't give up the other cells if  he doesn't know about them.
He knows.
(gestures to Sharon) What about her briefing? The strategy  session -- she said the cells don't  know about each other, that they --
Devereaux ignores him. Turns to Sharon.
How long before he breaks?
At this rate. Too long. The theatre  was hit nine hours after we took  down the first cell.
So -- what other models do we have -- ?
No one wants to be the first to step into uncharted terra
Shaking.
Nobody answers.
What about it, Sharon?
-- Won't work.
Works for the Israelis.
Only in conjunction with sleep  deprivation. Needs at least thirty- six hours.
Hub stares at Sharon -- as the dark side of her professio life is revealed.
We don't have thirty-six hours.
Another silence. They're teetering on the edge of the aby
Electric shock?
The neurotransmitters just shut down.
Water?
Palestinian authority is producing  good intel using water.
Hub finally can't take another second. Even in theory.
Are you people insane --?
The time has come for one man to  suffer in order to save the lives of  hundreds
How about two men? How about three?  How about public executions, that  might work.
You're welcome to wait outside.

General... you've lost men, I've  lost men... but what you're doing...  It doesn't work in Belfast. It doesn't  work in Gaza. And it won't work here. (it comes slowly at  first, then in a  rush:) -- What if... they don't want their  leader back at all? You said yourself,  we don't even have him. Maybe what  they really want -- is that we herd  our children into stadiums. Put  soldiers into our streets. Radicalize  people who want to think of themselves  as Americans. Bend the law, shred  the constitution. (searches for the  kind of words that  come so hard to him:) Because if we torture him -- and  let's call it what it is... You...  and I... then the country men like  us have sworn to defend. And bled to  defend. And died to defend... is  gone. (a deep breath) And they've won.
Gen. Devereaux stares hard at Hub. And then:
(to Col. Hardwick) I think we have to soundproof the  room before we begin.
Hub looks at Sharon, who looks away.
Escort him out.
The two MPs lead Hub out of the room.
Let's get this over with.
Sequence omitted from original script.
Sharon emerges from the shower room. She is shattered. Th blood drained from her face. As if carrying with her all sin that was committed in the next room.
The sound of a GUNSHOT. The door opens and Devereaux emer in the torment of a man of honor who is living a lie.
He knew nothing.
Devereaux turns and walks off down the corridor. Sequence omitted from original script.
Glorious, alabaster stone -- floodlit at night. A symbol all that is good and free and just. Hub drives a rental c staring out at the monuments.
Hub pulls up to a lovely TOWNHOUSE. Parked on the street, UNMARKED CAR from the Secret Service.
Opens the door, wearing a Dartmouth lacrosse team t-shirt
C'mon in, we're still trying to get  the last one down.
In the background, we HEAR a three-year-old crying.
Tasteful antiques, rag rugs and kids' toys.
...The President wants this shit  over with. There's only one way to  do that. (looks at Hub) Let the Sheik go.
So we do have the Sheik?
You think our government operates as  a single coherent entity? Devereaux  just... pushed the agenda. (carefully) Of course the President was completely  unaware of it.
(return of serve) Of course.
Now we can't just let him go. America  has to stand tall in the world yadda  yadda yadda. So what we do is... (the punch line) We let the American justice system  do its work.
His wife appears, holding a squalling baby, looking defea
-- Honey...?
I'll be right up, darling.
She grits her teeth and goes upstairs.
You have kids? They're great.  Sometimes you just want to... drug  them.
What do you mean, let the justice  system do its work.

We don't release him. A judge releases  him. You're an FBI man. That's what  judges are good at, right? (off Hub's look) It's not like we've gone after him  in proper prosectorial fashion.  Kidnaping him. Holding him in  isolation. "Fruit of the poisoned  tree" -- remember that one from law  school? Oh, we'll have a big trial.  Everybody'll get their rocks off...  But the fact is -- (the punch line) -- the sheik will walk.
He looks at Hub, shakes his head.
...And this whole episode becomes  nothing more than the news cycle  before the next news cycle.
He hands Hub an ACCORDION FILE.
Documentary evidence of Devereaux's  whole operation.
Why me?
Because you'll know what to do with  it.
Hub looks at the file in his hands. Considering.
And what about her?
Who?
You know who. How much is she  complicit in all this?
Ask her.
Hub looks up. Sharon emerges from the hallway. Sequence omitted from original script.
Hub and Sharon sit in silence in Hub's rental car:

I ran an Iraqi network for two years.  Samir recruited them from among the  Sheik's followers. I trained them in  the North. Then we played them back  into Baghdad, two, three at a time,  hiding them in the mosques...
Her voice softens just a bit as memory takes over.
It was gonna be beautiful. (looks away) -- And then there was a policy shift --
She thought telling the story would be easy, but there's enormous well of untapped feeling. She fights it back:

-- The new doctrine was: Iran will  be too powerful if Iraq falls apart. (her voice trembles) And it's not like... we sold them  out. Exactly. We just... stopped...  helping them. And I wasn't allowed  to tell them what was coming down. I  was ordered not to tell them. (fighting back tears) -- And they got slaughtered.
She turns away.

You've got to understand -- these  people... believe. Paradise. Bliss.  To us they're just words. But to  them... It's very beautiful, actually.  And when you look at their lives,  the heartbreak... And what do we do?  We think, aha, we can take advantage  of that. (losing it) So I quit. I came home. I just  can't... do it... anymore.
She doesn't want to reveal herself this way. Doesn't want be vulnerable. Doesn't want to cling to him. For a moment puts his arms around her, but it's like holding a beautif dangerous predator.
-- But first, you helped them.
She senses the hardness in his tone. Looks up at him, and through tears, puts her game face back on.
What do you mean --?
They were being slaughtered. They  needed to get out. But they were on  the watch list. So you got them visas.  You and Samir.
I promised we would take care of  them. They were working... for us.
Doing what, exactly?
I don't know what you mean.

You said you trained them. Tradecraft.  Subversion. That's what you said,  right? (she nods) Only you left something out, didn't  you... Didn't you, Sharon? (she can't bring  herself to look at  him) You taught them how to make bombs.
The tears are streaming down her face now. Finally, she n
-- And now they're here, doing what  you taught 'em.
The streetlight catches Sharon's face. Her eyes are haunt
And I'm going to have to live with  the hell of that for the rest of my  life.
-- the people of Brooklyn will not  be held hostage! This afternoon,  join community and religious leaders  in a march to protest the mass arrests --
Sequence omitted from original script.
Sequence omitted from original script.
(handing out leaflets) March on city hall. Today. No fear.

Hub and Frank are standing outside Hub's car, each on opp sides, blocking any opportunity to suveil what is happeni within. Sharon sits inside with Samir. She uses a SCALPEL to make the slightest INCISION under Samir's arm. The RADIO plays
Ahhhhhh...
In case you decide to go on walkabout.
Into the incision she inserts a tiny plastic TRANSMITTER.
How did you make contact?
He is Afghani. Ahhhh. He got word to  my uncle at the bath-house. You never  met him.
But you're sure he'll show up.
(trembling) Sharon, they are all dead but the  last cell and they are crazy with  fear. Just tell me the message and I  will pass it on.
I need to deliver it in person.  Believe me, they'll want to hear  what I have to say.
She turns off the radio.
Hub and Frank glance inconspicuously around.
You watch the game?
On a piece of paper he has scribbled, "Hit Hardwick. Safe House. 11:00."
(nods yes, then:) Kannell was really on.
Hub then writes. "Bath-house. 12:00."
(nods again) Think they'll make the play-offs?
Hub looks at him. There's been little time for sentiment.
How's your boy?
He's alright. Thanks for getting him  out.
Sharon steps out of the car. In her hands is a device  resembling a PORTABLE OSCILLOSCOPE. A green dot appears.
That's Samir.
(looks in at Samir) Green is about right.
He slips Sharon the scribbled notes. As she looks at them
He's terrified. Then again, so am I.
You sure he'll go through with it?
If he doesn't he knows I'll give him  to Devereaux. (She mouths, "They  out there?" Hub nods) How's it feel to be on the other end  of it?
I like watching better.
This is the endgame, you understand  that? If this goes wrong --
Nothing's going wrong.
We're the CIA, something always goes  wrong.
The car door opens and Samir steps out, buttoning his shi
I don't suppose there's any way you  would trust me to do this on my own? (off his look) I thought not. Well, in case it gets  hairy, remember... the most committed  wins.
Hub watches as she and Samir walk away.
I trust her about as far as I can  throw her.
That far?
They hurry through the park. Samir is extremely agitated, eyes constantly darting from right to left.
This is not the way to the bath-house.  You said to get a key from my uncle  so that we --
Shhhhhh... If you'd stop whining  you'd feel the surveillance.
Colonel Hardwick, earphones on, overhearing them:
Wait for the light to turn yellow  and then cross against the traffic.
On Col. Hardwick's computer, a GRID MAP of Brooklyn.
-- North on Ditmas Avenue.
Sound garden's ready.
On a nearby rooftop, an Army spotter uses a parabolic wit gunsight. Another mic is in a woman's shopping bag; anoth is in a twenty year-old's boom box.
(trembling) Sharon, please, I beg you. Do not  make me do this. If they even dream  we are being followed they will kill  us.
The light turns RED, they race across a crowded street.
Where women in chadors carry mesh bags with tonight's mea
Nothing but a single bed with a dirty white sheet. Sharon enters and turns on the TV... loud.
Sit. (takes out a pocket- knife) Raise your arm.
What are you doing?
She cuts the stitches under his armpit and begins to dig the transponder.
They cannot even dream we are being  followed, isn't that what you said?
Sharon very deliberately wipes her BLOODY HANDS on the WH SHEETS. On TV, we SEE the MARCHERS in front of Brooklyn Borough h
"-- that we will not be made afraid  to walk free in this great city. I  say, march across the bridge and  into the stadium. Demand the release  of --
Samir is staring at the TV.
It is all so... tragic.
(with rising dread) ...They're going to hit the march.
Arab and Jew, side by side. Black  and White, Christian and Muslim --
They appear as SPECTRAL images on Hardwick's microwave sc
-- so American. Can you imagine a  better target?
(into his handset) Get me Devereaux.
THE CROWD is getting fired up as the SPEAKER exhorts them SOLDIERS watch uneasily, not certain how to respond as th crowd begins to CHANT, "No Fear! No fear!" Sequence omitted from original script.
Sharon goes to a closet and takes out some old clothes. S TURNS OFF THE TV. Then:
Here. Put this on. We don't want our  friends sweating too much while they  wait.
Hardwick speaks into a handset.
They're getting ready to move. Units  1 and 2, on my signal --
Seem to materialize out of nowhere -- boxing them in.
What the --
Undercover FEDERAL AGENTS roust Army CID agents. An FBI a with a deep drawl, spread-eagles one against a building:
Hi, there, I'm new in town. Can you  direct me to Carnegie Hall, or should  I just go fuck myself --
The NYPD under the command of Danny Sussman -- roll up th rest of the sound garden -- examine the parabolic microph
Blow off the rear door of the surveillance van. Frank ent and looks around at all the high-tech, microwave technolo
Ah, microwave.

In chadors, faces VEILED, descend a back staircase. Only their faces emerge from the shadows and are caught by a d bulb do we recognize Sharon and Samir. Sharon unlocks a metal door to reveal THE HIDDEN COURTYAR of a neighboring building. She and Samir hurry through a  back alley and out into an adjacent street.
Where several APC's suddenly roar up and BLOCK off the sq Devereaux stands nearby, watching as:
(though a bullhorn) This is an unlawful gathering. You  must disperse. I repeat --
Soldiers in full RIOT GEAR emerge to form a battle line:  images of Selma, 1963; Chicago, 1968; Los Angeles, 1993.
Join together! Join hands!
Arab clerics and Hassidic rabbis, Black civic leaders and Hispanic gang members -- all continue to CHANT, "No fear!
Nervously look at one another as the  marchers begin to move.
(through a bullhorn) These soldiers carry live ammunition.  This is your final warning.

"No Fear... No Fear..." Devereaux watches in dread as the marchers close the gap on the battle-line of anxious sold is this why he became a soldier? A YOUNG GIRL unselfconsciously approaches a young soldier Looks into his eyes. Smiles. And walks past. Another marc walks right past a soldier, who does nothing to stop her. Soon, they are all surging past the riot-line. DEVEREAUX watches, as something is revealed to him, somet about America that, until this moment, he had forgotten.
Frank is fiddling with the new technology like a kid at  Christmas. But something is wrong. Where once there were GHOSTLY IMAGES of Samir and Sharon in the apartment -- no there is NOTHING.
The RADIO-SIGNAL of Samir's transmitter still registers a an unmoving, steadily blinking light. Hub is watching the building. Frank steps out the van, his face pale.
We've got a problem.
Pound up the stairs of the building.

head_text.subj: THE DOOR TO THE CLEAN APARTMENT

text: Bursts open. Hub comes in low and fast. Frank comes in ha on his heels. In the center of the otherwise empty room, the white shee SMEARED IN BLOOD, is draped over a chair.
What the --
Hub stares in dread fascination.
It's a shroud.
And he's out the door in a heartbeat. Sequence omitted from original script.
Frank and Hub listen to a playback of Sharon's conversati with Samir on the digital recorders.
"...sweating too much while they  wait."
Frank looks up at Hub.
First she turns off the tv, then she  says it.
She knew we were listening.
It hits them both at the same time.
The hammam.
Sequence omitted from original script.
Hub and Frank hit the street at a dead run.
Samir opens a padlocked door with a key. He and Sharon  disappear within.
An Arab bath-house. Rays of sunlight play off the steamin waters. Their footsteps ECHO off the tiled mosaic walls. Sequence omitted from original script.
Samir kneels to touch the steaming water.
How soon are they coming?
They'll be here.
He starts taking off his clothes.
What are you doing --?
He finishes disrobing.
He steps into the bath. With a sponge he washes his body.
What message do you have for them,  Sharon?
I'll tell them when they're here.
The DISTANT SOUND of the approaching MARCH echoes off the tiled walls as Samir steps out of the purifying waters an takes a towel from a hamper.
Nobody else is coming, is there?
That's right.
From the hamper he takes a Sig-Sauer .9 automatic.
You're the last cell.
There will never be a last cell. (racks the slide of  the .9) You should listen to the young men  in that stadium. It is just beginning.
Sharon watches, in dread fascination, as he takes a white egyptian-cotton FUNERAL SHROUD and drops it over his head
Are streaming down the street. Hub and Frank desperately fight their way through a wild, almost "carnival" feel.
Reflected in the purifying waters, Samir is putting civil clothes on over the shroud -- still holding the .9 on Sha
How could I have missed the play --
(a forgiving gesture) It was the money. You believe money  is power. Belief is power.
-- Just tell me we didn't finance  your operation...
(a sad smile) The world is a wheel. So... what  message do you have for me, Sharon?
They're going to release him.
Praise God. When will he be free --?
A few months at most. First, they  have to bring him to trial, but --
He turns away from her, opening the hamper.
(not looking at her) -- No.
-- But... that's what you want, isn't  it? Why you've done all this --
Comes next. Velcro straps fasten the belt around his ches
No. It's not.
He comes to stand beside her.
I want you to bleed... as we have  bled.
Samir, the Koran preaches --

Do not speak to me of the Koran,  woman. (fighting his emotion) You take our leader. A holy man. You  put him in prison for preaching the  word of God. You must learn the  consequences of trying to tell the  world how to live.
(with rising terror) But it's over, your point's been  made, why spill any more blood? Those  poor people out there in the street,  they're fucking marching for your  cause...
Yes. (fastens the last  strap on his semtex  harness) And they, too, will become its  martyrs.
A VOICE from the top of the stairs:
Let her go and you'll live.
Samir looks up, sees Hub aiming his .45. But Sharon is be them, blocking his shot. From outside, we HEAR the sound of the marchers' CHANTING "No Fear...! No Fear...!" Samir HEARS it, too.
Move away from the door.
Let her go and you'll live --
(screaming, panicked) GET AWAY FROM THE DOOR --!!!
SAMIR --!
YOU WANT TO DIE --!!
They're all SCREAMING at once. Still Samir keeps inching  toward the stairs. Hub blocks the way.
No way you're going out there.
Samir jams the gun into Sharon's ribs.
MOVE AWAY --!
Sharon's eyes meet Hubs'.
Shoot.
Shut up.
Shoot.
SHUT UP...
